body.p:
Greenupsburg, Ky,
May 22, 1862,
My dear Governor,

Our mutual friend, Geo E. Roe, Eqr, became the surety of Thomas Cassidy, on a recognizance bond, for his appearance at the present ^last^ term of the Greenup Circuit Court; and Cassidy having made default, being absent from the state, judgment was rendered against Mr Roe for $100 at the present term, It will be a hardship upon Mr Roe to pay the amount of the judgment, and as Cassidy may yet appear and answer the charge against him, I ask respectfully that the judgment against Mr Roe may be remitted,

Greenup Cir. Ct
$100 } For Recog
Geo. E Roe
Is May 28 1862
